name: Video Server & CDN
description: Sector template for video streaming server infrastructure, CDN technology, and content delivery optimization patents.
contextDescription: Video server and CDN patents cover the infrastructure for delivering streaming content at scale. Key areas include origin servers, edge caching, transcoding/packaging, manifest generation (HLS, DASH), multi-CDN orchestration, and quality-based routing. Major targets include cloud providers (AWS, Azure, GCP), CDN operators (Akamai, Cloudflare, Fastly), and streaming platforms (Netflix, Disney+, YouTube).
scoringGuidance: Edge computing and distributed transcoding patents are high value as streaming shifts to the edge.
Multi-CDN orchestration and failover patents target large streaming operations with redundancy requirements.
Real-time packaging (just-in-time transcoding) patents are valuable for live streaming use cases.
Patents covering manifest manipulation for ABR optimization have broad applicability.
Look for patents that reduce origin load or improve cache hit ratios - these have direct cost implications.

questions.question: What layer of streaming infrastructure does this patent address? Score 1-3 for origin-only, 4-6 for edge/CDN, 7-10 for end-to-end or multi-layer orchestration.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Identify whether the patent covers origin server, edge cache, mid-tier, or orchestration across layers.

questions.question: Does this patent address video transcoding or packaging? Score 1-3 if not applicable, 4-6 for basic transcoding, 7-10 for advanced (just-in-time, per-title encoding, AI-based).
questions.reasoningPrompt: Assess transcoding sophistication: static vs dynamic, quality optimization, codec flexibility.

questions.question: Does this patent relate to adaptive bitrate streaming or manifest generation? Score 1-3 if not applicable, 4-6 for basic HLS/DASH, 7-10 for advanced ABR optimization (CMAF, low-latency, LL-HLS).
questions.reasoningPrompt: Identify ABR protocols (HLS, DASH, CMAF) and manifest optimization techniques.

questions.question: Does this patent optimize caching or content delivery? Score 1-3 if not applicable, 4-6 for basic caching, 7-10 for advanced (predictive caching, cache warming, popularity-based).
questions.reasoningPrompt: Assess cache efficiency improvements and their impact on hit ratio or origin offload.

questions.question: Does this patent address multi-CDN strategies or orchestration? Score 1-3 if single-CDN only, 4-6 for basic multi-CDN, 7-10 for intelligent orchestration (quality-based routing, cost optimization).
questions.reasoningPrompt: Large streaming platforms use multiple CDNs. Assess multi-CDN decision-making and failover capabilities.
